citeinfo.title: State Conservation Lands; staCons18
citeinfo.othercit: Suggested bibliographic reference: RIGIS, 2018. State Conservation Lands; staCons18. Rhode Island Geographic Information System (RIGIS) Data Distribution System, URL: http://www.rigis.org, Environmental Data Center, University of Rhode Island, Kingston, Rhode Island (last date accessed: 8 January 2019).

citeinfo.origin: Rhode Island Geographic Information System (RIGIS) Data Distribution System
citeinfo.title: Rhode Island Geographic Information System (RIGIS)

descript.abstract: Approximate edges of Conservation Lands protected by the State of Rhode Island through Fee Title Ownership, Conservation Easement, or Deed Restriction. Includes: Wildlife Management Areas, Drinking Water Supply Watersheds, State Parks, Beaches, Bike Paths, Fishing Access Areas, Local Parks and Recreation Facilities that have been developed with State Grant Funds.
descript.purpose: General reference for planning purposes and small scale cartographic output.

idinfo.useconst: This dataset is provided 'as is.â€™ The producer(s) of this dataset, contributors to this dataset, the Rhode Island Geographic Information System (RIGIS) consortium, the State of Rhode Island, and the University of Rhode Island do not make any warranties of any kind for this dataset, and are not liable for any loss or damage however and whenever caused by any use of this dataset. Please acknowledge both RIGIS and the primary producer(s) of this dataset in any derived products. Versions of the RIGIS logo suitable for both printed and web-based products are available at http://info.rigis.org/logos. The following disclaimer must appear on all map produced with this dataset: These data were created by RIDEM for informational, planning and guidance use only. They are meant for use as a general reference, not a legally authoritative source for the location of natural or manmade features. Proper interpretation of these data may requre the assistance of appropriate professional services. Locations have not been verified by a RI Registered Professional Land Surveyor and are not intended to be used in place of a survey. RIDEM makes no warranty, express or implied, related to the accuracy, reliability, completeness, or currentness of this map.

cntorgp.cntorg: State of Rhode Island, Department of Environmental Management

procstep.procdesc: Property boundary delineations were derived from a variety of sources including: Municipal Tax Assessors data in GIS format Scanned and Georegistered Paper Tax Assessors Maps Digital and/or Scanned and Georegistered Survey Documents Hand drawn sketches Attributes were drawn from: Tax Assessors on-line sources Visits with local Planners & Tax Assessors and with the responsible land conservation organizations. All data was reviewed for accuracy by local sources.
Data contributed to RIGIS by the Rhode Island Department of Environmental Management. Metadata were reviewed, corrections made to formatting, RIGIS distribution information added.

cntorgp.cntorg: University of Rhode Island Environmental Data Center

mapproj.mapprojn: NAD 1983 StatePlane Rhode Island FIPS 3800 Feet

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: 4 digit code used to reference an internal DEM database of property records.
Describes the division, office or program responsible for the parcel or easement acquisition.
Associates the parcel with a park or management area.
Current common name of the property or its previous owner.
Describes the State's interest in the parcel (fee title, easement, etc.)
Hunting allowed (Y) or hunting not allowed (N).
Describes the parcel edge source data (survey, assessors parcel, sketch).
The year in which the property was conserved.
Property conserved partly or wholly with State Open Space Bond funding.
Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

cntorgp.cntorg: University of Rhode Island Environmental Data Center
